name: Vegetarian Summer Rolls
author: Elise Wolff Goldstein
summary: After enjoying summer rolls for years at our favorite Thai restaurant, we decided to create our own home version. My 11-year-old enjoys making these and we all enjoy eating them because they're delicious and very healthy! These make excellent appetizers or can be a main course!
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) package firm tofu, drained and cubed
½ cup Thai peanut sauce, or more to taste
directions: Spray a large pan or wok with cooking spray and heat over medium heat
Add tofu and cook, shaking the pan as needed, until browned on all sides, 8 to 10 minutes
Pour some water into a large, shallow plate

Place 1 spring roll wrapper in the water until soft, about 15 seconds, Remove to a work surface and place about 1 tablespoon tofu, 1 tablespoon cucumber, and 2 tablespoons broccoli slaw on the edge of the wrapper
Fold in the sides and wrap ingredients so it looks like an egg rolls
